name: Lt Gen David A. Deptula, USAF (Ret.)
**China Policy**: CSIS, Brookings, AEI, Heritage, Hudson, CNAS, CFR, Peterson, GMF, Wilson Center, FDD, NBR, ASPI
**Trade & Economics**: Peterson, CAP, PIIE, Asia Society, GMF, Brookings
**Technology & Cyber**: Atlantic Council, GMF, CNAS, FDD, Third Way (former)
**Middle East**: ISW, FDD, CAP, Hudson, Quincy Institute, Stimson
**Europe & Transatlantic**: GMF, CNAS, Atlantic Council, Quincy Institute
Direct web searches of institutional websites
Staff directory pages and web fetching
**Geographic Focus**: All institutions DC-based or have major DC presence
**Political Spectrum**: Ranges from progressive (CAP) to conservative (Heritage, AEI) to non-partisan (CSIS, RAND, Brookings) to restraint-focused (Quincy)
**Research Approach**: Mix of traditional think tanks and "action tanks"
**Funding Models**: Foundation-funded, corporate-funded, government contracts, individual donors
Adjunct/nonresident fellows may not all be captured
Staff turnover means some listings may be dated
Government transitions (e.g., Mieke Eoyang to DoD) create gaps
Monitor new program launches and fellows
